image.altText: The exterior of a modern building made from concrete and glass that reads "John Curtin School of Medical Research" on the side.

props.synopsis: A damning independent review into gender and cultural issues at the Australian National University's College of Health and Medicine reveals a "dysfunctional culture" of bullying, sexism, unfair workloads and nepotism.

title.children: ANU review slams medical college's 'remarkable tolerance for bullying'

image.altText: A police car behind police tape.

props.synopsis: Van Thanh Vu pleads guilty to murdering his partner in their family home in Canberra's north in 2023.

title.children: Man who stabbed partner to death in kitchen pleads guilty to murder

image.altText: 11 women standing behind a table with a cake on it with their hands up in celebration.

props.synopsis: What started out as three women called Shirley having a cuppa became an international club with thousands of members. But now the future of the club is bleak.

title.children: Shirley hated her name until she joined a same-name club

image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A former sex worker stealthed by a customer tells the ACT Supreme Court despite the pain and suffering she hopes her attacker will find it "in his soul to become a better person".

title.children: Former Canberra sex worker tells of 'turmoil' after being stealthed

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRL player Joe Tapine speaks to referee Adam Gee as rain falls during a game.

props.synopsis: Canberra coach Ricky Stuart warns against punishing aggression in rugby league as we head into the men's State of Origin series opener on Wednesday night.

title.children: Three Raiders charged as Ricky Stuart issues Origin warning

image.altText: A small tree with an orange banksia flower.

props.synopsis: Australian flora was once deemed too difficult to cultivate as bonsai but those misconceptions are fading with every native bud.

title.children: In recent years the banksia has become a surprise bonsai

image.altText: Trump time cover 2024

props.synopsis: TIME's longtime creative director tells the ABC incumbent US President Donald Trump has created a unique challenge for the magazine.

title.children: Treating Trump with 'respect': TIME magazine's creative director on capturing the US president

image.altText: Charlotte Walker smiles as she sits wearing a black blazer

props.synopsis: South Australia's Charlotte Walker has become the nation's youngest senator, snaring the state's sixth upper house seat at just 21, and says she hopes to bring 'a different perspective' to the Labor Party.

title.children: At just 21, Charlotte Walker is Australia's youngest senator

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a composite with a woman with brunette hair.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Senator Jacqui Lambie has been re-elected, while Pauline Hanson's daughter Lee has missed out, as results are finalised from the May 3 federal election.

title.children: Lambie successful, Hanson misses out, as Senate results finalised

image.altText: Flood rubbish outside a home.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of flood-damaged homes and shops have been declared uninhabitable as a massive clean-up and recovery operation continues across the NSW Mid North Coast and Hunter regions.

title.children: Almost 800 properties 'uninhabitable' after record floods on NSW Mid North Coast

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police have renewed their appeal for information or sightings of a Grey Hyundai ix35 around the Gin Gin area on May 15 to 18.

title.children: Mystery around last known movements of missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Power cords plugged into electricity socket

props.synopsis: This week electricity regulators set caps for how much retailers can charge customers on certain plans. Here's how they could affect you.

title.children: State-by-state breakdown of power increases expected from July 1

image.altText: Police officers in high-viz clothing stand near ambulances in the street after an incident at a parade

props.synopsis: A man is arrested after a car hit pedestrians in the UK city of Liverpool during celebrations over the local football club's Premier League victory.

title.children: Dozens of Liverpool fans injured after car drives through victory parade

image.altText: A white rugby ball with no branding rests on the grass of a playing field

props.synopsis: Police say the game was based on a social media-driven trend where participants compete in full-contact collisions without protective gear.

title.children: NZ teen dies from head injuries after 'tackle game' with friends

image.altText: Deputy Police Commissioner David Hudson at a press conference

props.synopsis: Police have vowed to "find every single one of these crooks" with a new mega taskforce formed in response to a spate of underworld attacks to rock Sydney in the past fortnight.

title.children: 'A cell or in the morgue': Grim warning as mega taskforce targets underworld

image.altText: A Samoan woman sitting in red and black patterned outfit with short white hair and red flower behind her ear.

props.synopsis: One of the Pacific's only female leaders, Samoan Prime Minister Fiame Naomi Mata'afa, has lost her grip on power after a long-running political saga, triggering an early election.

title.children: Samoa's parliament deals fatal blow to its first female PM's government

image.altText: A woman sitting on a verandah and smiling.

props.synopsis: Sue Roman was one of hundreds of children taken from the notorious Darwin mission Retta Dixon and sent across the country to work as a servant.

title.children: Forced into slavery at 12, Sue Roman brought a royal commission to Darwin

image.altText: A woman on stage holds a microphone.

props.synopsis: A decision to align a far-right network with the Voice of America prompts concern, as Beijing-backed media continues to build its radio presence.

title.children: 'Under attack from our own': Journalists in US fight back against Trump

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: European markets have reacted to a sharp shift in US tariffs. Locally our market is awaiting new data on inflation that will inform when the next RBA interest rate cut is likely to occur. Follow live.

title.children: European tariff reaction, market awaits inflation read to inform next RBA rate cut

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Insurance Council of Australia upgrades classification of floods to "insurance catastrophe"
Real estate group REA probed by ACCC
Weak Chinese demand for coal, but prices still rising globally

image.altText: Australian banknotes

props.synopsis: About 9 million Australians claim roughly $28 billion worth of work-related expenses each year. The ATO discusses the dos and don'ts of claiming deductions on your returns this tax time, and how it identifies dodgy claims.

title.children: Doing your own tax return after July 1? The ATO has some stern advice

image.altText: A driveway and open wooden gate next to a single-storey house in a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Burnett MP Stephen Bennett says residents are struggling to process the death of the little girl. A woman has been charged with murder and is expected to face court today.

title.children: Small seaside town reeling after alleged murder of three-year-old girl

image.altText: a shopfront in petersham with the window defaced

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old is accused of defacing property on six occasions, including the Pride Square display at Newtown, federal election campaign posters and an LGBT welcome sign at the Imperial Hotel.

title.children: Man's dozens of graffiti tags 'certainly incite hatred'

image.altText: A mid-shot of WA Premier Roger Cook wearing a blue suit and yellow tie, speaking into microphones.

props.synopsis: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia will be compensated through a state government redress scheme, Premier Roger Cook announces.

title.children: WA government announces redress scheme for Stolen Generations

image.altText: Gabriela Bryan cutting back on wave flicking spray high into air

props.synopsis: Hawaii's Gabriela Bryan and South Africa's Jordy Smith come out on top in a dramatic leg of the World Surf League's Championship Tour in Western Australia.

title.children: Young star and tour veteran claim victory at the Margaret River Pro

image.altText: Someone holding three credit cards with one hand and selecting one with the other.

props.synopsis: Movie tickets, department store wares and flights are just some of the things people 'pay' for using credit card reward points But, rewards come with risks.

title.children: 'You pay for what you get': Are credit cards with reward points worth it?

image.altText: A corkboard filled with photos and documents connected by pinned thread. A photo of Margaret Thomas is in the middle.

props.synopsis: Retirees WA is suing the husband of its former chief executive in a bid to recoup millions of dollars loaned to companies linked to him.

title.children: Charity suing husband of former CEO in bid to claw back retirees' millions

image.altText: A man wearing a suit is shoved in the face by a woman wearing a red jacket who is blocked by a door

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron says he was "bickering, or rather joking" with his wife, Brigitte, when video captured her shoving him in the face while onboard the presidential jet that had touched down in Vietnam.

title.children: 'It's nothing': French president downplays face shove from wife

image.altText: A man put his hands up

props.synopsis: Held In the shadow of the Gaza war, one of the most prominent banners held by those marching read "Jerusalem in our hands, 1967. Gaza in our hands, 2025".

title.children: Israelis chant 'death to Arabs' in annual march through Jerusalem's Muslim Quarter

image.altText: June looks to the right of the camera while wearing the white handmaid bonnet and red cape.

props.synopsis: There are striking differences between the fanfare and cultural symbolism of earlier seasons of the Handmaid's Tale and its middling finale. How did the show lose its way?

title.children: Didn't finish the Handmaid's Tale? Here's why people stopped watching

image.altText: Braydon and Gavin Boggitt moving with the help of a carer.

props.synopsis: More people have been left scrambling in the wake of a disability accommodation company shutting down operations, including subcontractors, a former AFL footballer and a finance group from Asia.

title.children: Contractors, investors left scrambling after disability housing provider shutdown

image.altText: Close up of a woman's hands typing at a computer keyboard with some jewellery on and a large fitness watch on her wrist

props.synopsis: Productivity is dominating headlines, but is it really possible to measure in Australia?

title.children: The great productivity debate is totally unproductive

image.altText: A dust sky horizon on a high point with sea in the background.

props.synopsis: Parts of NSW woke up to a dust storm on Tuesday, with conditions expected to ease throughout the day pending westerly winds.

title.children: Dust haze descends on Sydney and Illawarra, causing 'hazardous' air quality

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair stands with two young boys by either side.

props.synopsis: A Queensland mother is procuring her legacy through a series of "healing" artworks that capture her most precious beachside family memories.

title.children: Mum turns to art while grieving future after terminal cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Participants compete in the women's downhill race category of the traditional annual Cheese Rolling contest

props.synopsis: German YouTuber Tom Kopke wins the Cooper's Hill cheese-rolling competition for the second year in a row.

title.children: Runners trip through downhill cheese chase in zany sports contest
